TopicTitle: What have you been playing recently? (Other than KSP)

Articles.Content:
Due to being insanely busy lately, I have barely touched my gaming laptop (even though I've had it with me most of the time). Instead, I've been playing Animation Throwdown on my phone. It's nice that you can jump in, play 2-3 games (which takes maybe 5 minutes) and hop back out.

I don't think I've played a non-KSP game on my computer since early October. And I've not played much KSP since then either :/

Edited November 14, 2016 by 5thHorseman

4 hours ago, Stewcumber said:

That's great! I've played about 3h of From the Depths but never got as far as making anything that big, airborne or... functional . I get phases of trying to figure it out (usually after a re-stumble across the steam launch trailer)

84 hours, and it's just starting to click. Can't make a cannon worth a damn, and CPBs need crazy amounts of power, so my little noob ships are basically useless.
If I'm not on KSP, I'm either on Space Engineers, Fo4, Witcher 3, or War Thunder. Mostly Fo4 with the FROST mod tho
I've been playing CS:GO now due to friends, and I have to say, I almost dehydrate every time I play due to so many salty players.
IL-2: 1946 in multiplayer.

Lately, Mass Effect, again. Other than that, I still have an X-COM campaign to finish, Elite:Dangerous to get back to eventually, pending better Internet connection... Extremely occasional World of Tanks (I play a few games then drop it again for a few months...) and, even rarer, League of Legends, when I have company to play with

Anybody have any thought on these 3 games?

-Universe Sandbox 2

-Take on Mars

-Waking Mars

I'm looking for something else to play next to KSP... if I should ever tire of KSP that is.

CSGO, HOI 4, and EU4. Trying to think about a Jool-5 in KSP to get me back into it, not sure I have the time though.

A cool thing about HOI 4 though is that my dad bought it and I'm trying to teach him how to play. We tried multiplayer and we lagged to death, should work today though.

I mostly play Red Orchestra 2, Burnout Paradise and some Far Cry: Blood Dragon.

Sadly im always tired and most of the time I just look at my games list with a blank stare before goig to youtube

IL-2 1946

FSX original disc acceleration 

My own game I am making on unity
World of Tanks Blitz on my iPad, as the only computer game I play is KSP

On 25/11/2016 at 9:45 PM, Dafni said:

Anybody have any thought on these 3 games?

-Universe Sandbox 2

-Take on Mars

-Waking Mars

I'm looking for something else to play next to KSP... if I should ever tire of KSP that is.

I have universe sandbox (1) but it crash more times than I can tolerate. I don't know if the second version is more stable. It was a good simulator, especially once you know things about orbital mechanics and when you can understand the meaning of cunfusing numbers displayed.

Take on mars sounds promising, but it lacks of positive responses so I just put it on my "follow" list at this moment.

I have no idea about the third title.

 

Anyway, I played FSX a lot until few months ago. Then gradually I lost interest because lack of co-op feature on my favourite planes.

2 hours ago, notsobrightguy said:

I have universe sandbox (1) but it crash more times than I can tolerate. I don't know if the second version is more stable. It was a good simulator, especially once you know things about orbital mechanics and when you can understand the meaning of cunfusing numbers displayed.

Take on mars sounds promising, but it lacks of positive responses so I just put it on my "follow" list at this moment.

I have no idea about the third title.

 

Anyway, I played FSX a lot until few months ago. Then gradually I lost interest because lack of co-op feature on my favourite planes.

Thanks for sharing your thoughts. I went ahead and bought all 3 of them, lets see if my KSP addiction eases off a little and I'll find time to really dive into one of them.

The third title is a kind of peaceful platformer, sounds promising. People comment about the scenic Mars cave exploring etc.
Mostly Prepar3D and BeamNG.
Just got into World of Warships, I suck, but I'm having fun. The Bismarck is such a beauty.
No Man's Sky (yes) and Obduction, by Cyan.

I picked up Dishonored and all the DLCs for a song on Steam, been playing that exclusively for the last week. I got the second one as a gift from the friend who convinced me the first was a good buy. Having a lot of fun with it; I can play it like the old Thief games and have random spats of slashing throats for fun, and the lore is simply fantastic.

I just bought the "disasters" pack for Cities: Skylines and have been playing that. I've also bought another "pre-release" game, Sol 0: Mars Colonization. Here's the Steam link if you're interested: http://store.steampowered.com/app/387370/

Lately I've been playing Gloria Victis (Steam link here), an Early Access game on Steam.  While many may avoid Early Access games, I happened to pick up KSP when it was EA and look what it turned into!
Civ 6 for me
Played a Minecraft UHC with @MatoroIgnika and other people yesterday. My team won, end was a 3v1 against Mat, we won.
Still playing Crash Drive 2 when I get bored with the design problems of building a 200 kiloton space battleship without AutoStrut. Except now I whip everyone at that game. It's nice.
Forza 5, Space Engineers, Elite: Dangerous, Star Trek Online and Homeworld Remastered Edition
Kerbal Space Program --- wait
Got addicted to Garry's Mod again, getting more and more creative with wiremod. It's a great game.
